nodes.text: It is impossible to fault the architects of the merger of University College London (UCL) and Imperial College for the scale of their ambition
This is about creating the world's number one university  claims Sir Derek Edwards the provost of UCL.
If the ambition is to create the best university in the world one cannot fault it for its scale.
If one is creating a university to rival the world's best university it follows that one is aiming to create the world's number one university.
This is about creating a university that rivals the world's best university.
This would put Oxford and Cambridge way way behind and would put us in a strong position to rival Harvard.
Harvard is the world's number one university.
